history.content:
Hi! I’m in a club called Effective Altruists of UC Berkeley. Effective altruism is a philosophy and social movement focused on answering one question: how can we help others as much as possible? We rigorously consider our moral values, the most effective interventions, and how we can tangibly direct our livelihoods to maximize our impact.

We’re an interdisciplinary club representing a vast range of majors, such as philosophy, economics, math, public health, or computer science. Personally, my involvement with effective altruism (EA) has inspired my long-term commitment to use my education as a stepping stone for altruistic aspirations.

We’re running a 4-6 week introductory reading group over the summer for those that want to learn about the key ideas of EA. We’re also organizing a 1-day retreat toward the end of the summer! This is targeted to those who are unfamiliar with or new to EA. :)

If you’d like to receive updates about our summer activities, fill out our interest form (here if the hyperlink doesn’t work: https://tinyurl.com/BerkeleyEA). Or learn more about effective altruism here.

Feel free to email admin@eaberkeley.com with any questions or concerns or schedule a 15 minute call with one of our organizers — we’re excited to meet you and hear about your interest in EA!
